span.span: This is an internet access survey so that we can determine the best way to serve our student body during this unprecedented time. Please fill out the Google survey. If you do not have the ability to fill the form out online, please fill out the paper copy that you will be receiving in the mail and mail it back to the school. Only one response is needed per household.

a.span: Click here to fill out the internet access survey

div.class: custom_143643 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn
div.p: Â Â Â Â Bray-Doyle Public School will be offering breakfast and lunch to the Bray-Doyle students, that have signed up for them, in a drive through format, beginning Monday, March 23rd.
PARENTS AND STUDENTS WILL REMAIN IN THEIR VEHICLES AT ALL TIMES AND WILL NOT BE ALLOWED INTO THE BUILDINGS.
Â Â Â Â Parents will follow the one way flow of traffic around the Middle School and the Gymnasium.

Â Â Â Â Vehicles will stop at a check station just before reaching the back door of the cafeteria, located between the Elementary building and the High School building.
This will allow us to determine the number of meals needed for the students of that family.
Vehicles will then proceed to the pickup station located at the back door of the cafeteria, to receive their meal.
Breakfast will be served from 8:00 AM to 10 AM and Lunches will be served from 10 AM toÂ 11:00 AM each day, Monday - Friday.Â

div.class: custom_142545 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: If you wish to sign your child up for breakfast and lunch during the school closing please send list of which children are eating to the following email bdpslunches@braydoyle.k12.ok.us

div.class: custom_141343 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn
div.p: The Bray-Doyle Public Schoolâ€™s cheer squad was at the Thunder game last night (3/11/2020) with several other schools to take part in the pregame cheer clinic.
A player for the Utah Jazz had tested positive for the Corona Virus, but did not attend the game.

Even though the Oklahoma Department of Health press release state that people at last nightâ€™s Thunder game are not in danger of contracting the Corono Virus, we will be dissmissing school today and tomorrow.
This is strictly an effort to both reassure the patrons of our district and to provide the safest environment possible for our students and staff.

It is the districtâ€™s practice to cancel all extra-curricular activites for any day in which school is dismissed.Â In keeping with this practice all extra-curricular activities for today and tomorrow will also be canceled.

span.span: All new students MUST provide the following items at enrollment
CDIB card for qualifying students, parents or grandparents
Parent or guardian will need to bring photo ID
10-12thÂ grade students will need their HS transcript (9thÂ grade will need report card from previous school)

p.strong: Please make sure you have a current immunization record on file with us.Â Seventh grade students must have a Tdap shot

div.p: The free and reduced lunch forms play a key role in school funding. Not only for the lunch program but also for the Title I, Title II, Title III, Title IV, Title V, Title Reap and federal school wide programs. Your information is kept private. Please help our students by turning in a form even if you don't think or know that your child qualifies. If you have any questions please feel free to call our offices.Â
Anyone wishing to view the Bray-Doyle Wellness Plan or the Wellness Assessment may view them in districtâ€™s central office.
